## BIO

<iframe src="https://giphy.com/embed/26u6dIwIphLj8h10A" width="480" height="480" frameBorder="0" class="giphy-embed" allowFullScreen></iframe><p><a href="https://giphy.com/gifs/26u6dIwIphLj8h10A">via GIPHY</a></p>

Giacomo Bignardi born in the humanities, with a degree in Drama, Art and Music Studies from the [University of Bologna](https://corsi.unibo.it/laurea/DAMS). He was then raised by scientists while doing a minor in [Brain and Mind](https://minor.vu.nl/nl/minoren/brain-and-mind), leaving home to research at the Complex Trait Genetic department at the [Vrije Universiteit](https://ctg.cncr.nl/) in Amsterdam. After, he tried to grow  up in London, studying Neuroaesthetics at [Goldsmiths, University of London](https://www.gold.ac.uk/pg/msc-psychology-arts-neuroaesthetics-creativity/), and collaborating with the NTR, at the [Biological Psychology Dept.](https://tweelingenregister.vu.nl/) (which is still in Amsterdam, he loves that city). 
All grown up, he is interested in aesthetics experiences, what they mean, and their underlying sources of etiological variation. Especially in the genetic ones.

This website is about the wanderings on the `science` and the `art` that surround the genetic architecture of aesthetic experiences.

## SKILLS


```{r figs, echo=FALSE}
m <- matrix(c( 3, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0,
              21.5, 0, 1.5, 7.0, 10,0, 
              10, 2, 3, 0, 3, 0, 
              0, 0, 0, 0, 5, 0,
              4, 4, 4 ,4 ,4 ,0,
              0, 0, 0.5, 2, 1.5, 1 ),
            byrow = TRUE,
            nrow = 6, ncol = 6)
haircolors <- c("Programming","Inferential Statistics", "Generative Art", "WebDesign", "Creativity","Design")

groupColors <- c("#ea4a35", "#F05934", "#f4981f", "#F29743", "#F4A647", "#F2CF60")

dimnames(m) <- list(have = haircolors,
                    prefer = haircolors)
circlize::chordDiagram(m, groupColors, annotationTrack = c("name", "grid"),
             annotationTrackHeight = c(0.03, 0.01))
```

SKILLS \ref{fig:figs} *a Chord Diagram that should kind of represent my skills. Arches represent the relative weight of one skill onto the other. Every data used for this graph has been made up by myself. Further investigation are needed to prove their validity. As you can see I am quite creative. However, there are not any divergent thinking or C scores are out there to certify it. Graph made using the R package [Circlize](https://github.com/jokergoo/circlize). Color palette from the [RothkoViz](http://ereyes.net/rothkoviz/00-colors.html) project, No.12, 1954. 'cause I cried once in front of it.*
